etymology.description: 氵(水, "water") represents the element of water -> 兩(两) (liǎng, "two") phonetic component, indicating similarity to calmness or balance -> final meaning "cool"
etymology.interpretation: The character 凉(涼) (liáng, "cool") combines the water radical 氵(水, "water") suggesting a cooling effect, with the phonetic component 兩(两), hinting at a balanced or moderate temperature.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing the phonetic component 兩 with its simpler variant 两 while retaining the original meaning.

examples.chinese: 今天天气很凉(今天天氣很涼)。
夏日午后虽热(夏日午后雖熱)，室内微风凉(室內微風涼)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàrì wǔhòu suī rè, shìnèi wēifēng liáng.
examples.english: Although the summer afternoon is hot, the indoor breeze is cool.
